message_1: What is the decay mode and the resulting product when the radioactive isotope of carbon, Carbon-14, undergoes beta decay?
message_2:
When Carbon-14 undergoes beta decay, it emits a beta particle (an electron) and an antineutrino. The decay mode is β- decay. The resulting product is Nitrogen-14, as one of the neutrons in the Carbon-14 nucleus is converted into a proton. The equation for this decay process is:

¹⁴C → ¹⁴N + β⁻ + ν̅e
